instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: Seeking Step-by-Step Guidance for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) Logic Board Repair
threads.message:
Hello,

I'm currently in the process of repairing an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) logic board. The problem was that it wouldn't turn on. I have taken out the logic board and tried to troubleshoot the problem, but I am struggling as I don't have any guides or references on how to resolve this issue. 

I connected the MagSafe lead with the DCPS and given the input from that to logic board, the led is glowing orange, I checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> it's ok, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is also ok, from here I don't know where to go. 

I would greatly appreciate it if you could provide me with a step-by-step instruction on how to fix this issue. Thank you.

threads.title: Seeking Step-by-Step Guidance for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) Logic Board Repair
threads.message:
"I checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> it's ok"
Does that mean to have 8.5V?
8.2V is not good at all.

Any history available?

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS?
